metadata.Title: CVE-2018-3977 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An exploitable code execution vulnerability exists in the XCF image rendering functionality of SDL2_image-2.0.3. A specially crafted XCF image can cause a heap overflow, resulting in code execution. An attacker can display a specially crafted image to trigger this vulnerability. USN-4238-1 addressed serveral vulnerabilities in SDL_image. This update provides the corresponding fixes for Ubuntu 14.04 ESM.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-3977` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl2-image-2.0-0 - 2.0.4+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.16.04.1
No subscription required

libsdl-image1.2 - 1.2.12-10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsdl2-image package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.4+dfsg1-2ubuntu2.16.04.1').
sdl-image1.2 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.12-10').
